data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2974910,"name":"acastagna","username":"acastagna","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a88e4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-11-04T14:31:14.750Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe are playing around with our first swerve drive system, and are wondering what other teams consider “fast enough” for the swerve motor to orient the swerve module? For example, if the wheel are oriented 0 degrees and the driver suddenly calls for 90 degrees (worst case scenario with optimized headings) how long should it take the module to get there?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWe are going to start tuning the position PID for those modules. Since l don’t know how to tune the PID parameters precisely?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":31,"updated_at":"2021-11-04T14:55:26.771Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":195,"readers_count":194,"score":49.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":397042,"topic_slug":"whats-a-reasonable-target-for-swerve-module-response-time","display_username":"Daniel Wenbo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":12381,"username":"Oblarg","name":"Eli Barnett","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48748,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/whats-a-reasonable-target-for-swerve-module-response-time/397042/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2974923,"name":"acastagna","username":"acastagna","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a88e4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-11-04T14:55:54.951Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eRight now we are using the Rev Hardware client for tuning, but are getting Shuffleboard set up to do our tuning  - using the network table to read changes to parameters and graph input/output.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":31,"updated_at":"2021-11-04T14:55:54.951Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":192,"readers_count":191,"score":53.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":397042,"topic_slug":"whats-a-reasonable-target-for-swerve-module-response-time","display_username":"acastagna","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":48748,"username":"mendax1234","name":"Daniel Wenbo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mendax1234/{size}/156242_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/whats-a-reasonable-target-for-swerve-module-response-time/397042/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2974924,"name":"Eli Barnett","username":"Oblarg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/oblarg/{size}/161674_2.png","created_at":"2021-11-04T14:56:42.954Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eThere’s no way to make a feedback loop do the job of a feedforward.  The feedback loop is constrained to be both reactive and (relatively) dumb.  It exists to reject disturbances whose nature we know very little about.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWe know quite accurately how dry friction behaves, and so we should account for it.  This has nothing to do with the PID.  A system with a good feedforward will be rather tolerant of different feedback gains, because there won’t be much to “fix” in the first place.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eThe mindset you should take towards \u003cem\u003eall\u003c/em\u003e control problems is: build a model, use that model to develop a feedforward, and then correct from that feedforward with an appropriate feedback loop.  This has the benefit of easily translating into the state-space paradigm, but it’s equally applicable even with a classical controls approach.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":31,"updated_at":"2021-11-04T15:02:42.093Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":193,"readers_count":192,"score":108.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":397042,"topic_slug":"whats-a-reasonable-target-for-swerve-module-response-time","display_username":"Eli Barnett","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":48748,"username":"mendax1234","name":"Daniel Wenbo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mendax1234/{size}/156242_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12381,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!"},"post_url":"/t/whats-a-reasonable-target-for-swerve-module-response-time/397042/12","custom_user_title":"Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2974925,"name":"Mark Wasserman","username":"Mark_Wasserman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mark_wasserman/{size}/9677_2.png","created_at":"2021-11-04T14:57:03.823Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003e1 degree per millisecond is a good goal.
